meanings.definition: A line of slaves or animals fastened or driven along together.
meanings.sent1: The coffles of animals moved slowly through the field.
meanings.sent2: The coffles of slaves were a heartbreaking sight.
meanings.sent3: The coffles of animals decided to have a race for fun.
meanings.sent4: The coffles of slaves symbolized the cruelty of the past.
meanings.sent5: The coffles of animals stretched as far as the eye could see.

meanings.definition: To fasten or drive slaves or animals in a line.
meanings.sent1: The farmer coffles the cows to the barn every evening.
meanings.sent2: She coffles the workers to the plantation for their daily tasks.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper coffles the penguins for their daily swim.
meanings.sent4: He coffles his thoughts together before making a decision.
meanings.sent5: The trainer coffles the dogs for their obedience training.
